text: I'm sorry you were singled out. That was not ok

elements.text: I'm sorry you were singled out. That was not ok

text: Me too. You did the right thing in that thread and I'm glad you handled that topic as you did.

elements.text: Me too. You did the right thing in that thread and I'm glad you handled that topic as you did.

text: the wild thing is that I was actively — from the getgo — trying to steer that conversation away from a language war

elements.text: the wild thing is that I was actively — from the getgo — trying to steer that conversation away from a language war

text: yeah - you've made sure they knew they were heard, and as far as I can tell, it was acknowledged!

elements.text: yeah - you've made sure they knew they were heard, and as far as I can tell, it was acknowledged!

text: I definitely think you and Stefan did the right thing. Paradox of tolerance is very real.

elements.text: I definitely think you and Stefan did the right thing. Paradox of tolerance is very real.

text: Fortunately, this doesn’t seem to be getting traction — at least not yet.

elements.text: Fortunately, this doesn’t seem to be getting traction — at least not yet.

text: don’t need to give it any more grip

elements.text: don’t need to give it any more grip

text: It's among the worst written critiques of anything I've ever read. If I were a moderator at hackernoon I would delete this in a second it's just smearing things and people without any substance whatsoever.

elements.text: It's among the worst written critiques of anything I've ever read. If I were a moderator at hackernoon I would delete this in a second it's just smearing things and people without any substance whatsoever.

text: Like who the fuck cares what a moderator did on some programming forum one time. Even if it was bad (which it wasn't). Just because you moderate something doesn't mean every call you make ever is perfect or something. I wouldn't stress this one bit Matt. I say some pretty crazy shit on the internet and I'm employed.

elements.text: Like who the fuck cares what a moderator did on some programming forum one time. Even if it was bad (which it wasn't). Just because you moderate something doesn't mean every call you make ever is perfect or something. I wouldn't stress this one bit Matt. I say some pretty crazy shit on the internet and I'm employed.

text: Fwiw I think a “language war” every once in a while is fine. If people want to argue for their favourite language against Julia or vice versa, let them argue. I don’t really see the harm in that as long as it’s civilised.

elements.text: Fwiw I think a “language war” every once in a while is fine. If people want to argue for their favourite language against Julia or vice versa, let them argue. I don’t really see the harm in that as long as it’s civilised.

text: Remember that even if this is your 10th time to see “this kind of debate”, it’s probably the author’s first time. Shooting down a post for turning into something “we have seen before” sends all kinds of unintentional messages to the author of the post.
